title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.84 - Executive Order No. 84: Extending the Period for Paying Real Property Taxes Without Interest in the Village of Arcade due to a Disaster Emergency. [*]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.84 - Executive Order No. 84: Extending the Period for Paying Real Property Taxes Without Interest in the Village of Arcade due to a Disaster Emergency. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on June 25, 1998, a series of severe
thunderstorms brought torrential rains and flash floods, deluging several
counties in New York State and causing emergency evacuations, damage to
residential and commercial properties, as well as the disruption of vital
transportation within the Counties of Clinton, Essex, Franklin and Wyoming and
contiguous areas; WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
damage to residential and commercial property, and it continues to pose a
threat to the public health and safety; WHEREAS, by Executive Order Number 82, I declared a
disaster emergency in the affected counties, and directed State agencies to
respond as necessary to assist those affected counties in restoring vital
public transportation systems and to provide such other assistance as necessary
to protect the public health and safety; WHEREAS, village property taxes for the 1998 fiscal year
are currently due in the Village of Arcade, County of Wyoming; WHEREAS, by virtue of section
1432
(1)
of the Real Property Tax Law, such taxes
would normally be payable without interest only through July 1, 1998; WHEREAS, such taxes would normally be subject to interest
if paid after that date; WHEREAS, section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, as added by
chapter 389 of the Laws of 1997, authorizes the Governor to issue an executive
order during a State disaster emergency, extending the period for paying real
property taxes without interest by up to seven days in a county, city, town, village or school district in the affected area, if the chief executive officer
of the county, city, town, village, or school district requests such an
extension; WHEREAS, a request for such an extension has been received
on behalf of the Village of Arcade; and
WHEREAS, given the hardships continuing to face the people
of the Village of Arcade as a result of the ice storm, such an extension is
warranted; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby
retroactively extend by seven days, the period for paying real property taxes
without interest that are currently due in the Village of Arcade as of July 1, 1998, so that such taxes shall be payable without interest through July 8, 1998. FURTHER, by virtue of the same section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, any taxes
not paid by such date shall be subject to the same penalties and interest that
would have applied if no such extension had been granted. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: July 7, 1998
